props.title: Byzantine Fault Tolerance (BFT)
props.description: Byzantine fault tolerance (BFT), is a property in the system that ensures there is resistance to certain types of failures.
props.body: A BFT system can continue to operate even if some nodes fail or malicious behavior occurs in the system.

about.name: Armada Alliance
about.description_short: Alliance of Raspberry Pi and ARM based Stake Pools.
about.description_long: The Armada alliance was formed in efforts to build a sustainable community of decentralized, low-cost, and energy-efficient stake pool operations on the Cardano blockchain 🌍🌿 All Stake Pools in this alliance run on either Raspberry Pis exclusively or on other low power consuming ARM-based machines with an average pool energy consumption of less than 40 Watts💡

items.name: Explore the idea where we set up a treasury where people can delegate to that will be automatically assigned to pools that are in need of delegation using smart contracts
Create a validation page for stake pool members of the alliance to check for missing info
Maintain Armada Alliance Official ARM-based static build using GitHub Actions and put people on a mailinglist for new releases (including pre-releases)
Release a YouTube video on how to setup a cardano node + cli & quick db sync with Docker in under 30 minutes
Explore utility tokens for delegators of our community
Mint specials tokens for delegators of our community
Simplify the registration process for new stake pools, most data already comes from metadata & extended metadata
Support metrics endpoint for stake pools that will expose basic metrics that can be shown on the website
Create a [repository](https://github.com/armada-alliance/armada-alliance) where people can register

pages.title: What is [staking](/en/terms/staking.md)?
pages.description: On the [Cardano](/en/terms/cardano.md) blockchain, the ada held by wallets represents the stake in the network; the ability to use your stake to either [pledge](/en/terms/pledge.md) or delegate is one of the core elements of Cardano.

pages.title: Wat is staken?
pages.description: Op de [Cardano](/en/terms/cardano.md) blockchain vertegenwoordigt de ada die door wallets wordt gehouden het belang in het netwerk; de mogelijkheid om uw inzet te gebruiken om ofwel [belofte](/en/terms/pledge.md) of delegeren is een van de kernelementen van Cardano.

pages.title: Chadi Nassar
pages.description: Chadi Nassar is a generative artist, who makes use of trained artificial intelligence to produce his work. His work in ‘Faces 1’ reflects emotions in a raw and reflection-inducing manner. Chadi Nassar believes in the power of emotions and that is evident through the emotions that one begins to interact with his work. Art to him is the bringing out of an emotional response to a sense; it could be visual, auditory, or really any other sense that the audience chooses to engage with the work.

pages.title: Marshall
pages.description: Marshall is an NFT artist that utilizes Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) as the medium to create his works. Fundamentally, he uses the physics of fluid flow, along with flow visualization techniques to create art. His work is the perfect marriage between the fixed laws of physics and the constantly evolving imaginative mind. He likes to inject fun into his works as well, evident in his 'How-Aerodynamic-is-My...' project, where he makes customized works for people.

pages.title: Docker, Plutus, Research and Charity ASTOR
Cardano ADA Mini Pool Switzerland MINI1
Pool should have at least one SPO
pages.description: Make sure to define at least one SPO in the pool markdown file.

pages.title: Every SPO should only operate one pool
pages.description: It's required to operate a single pool. We do not support pool-splitting.

pages.title: Every SPO should have a Telegram handle
pages.description: Make sure to define a Telegram handle for every SPO of your stake pool.

pages.title: Pool should have an image
pages.description: Make sure to have a logo of your pool specified in a extended metadata json file.

pages.title: Pool is recommended to have at least 2 relays
pages.description: It's a best practice to have at least 2 relays to be able to handle downtime of one of the relays.

pages.title: Pool should have their nodes defined
pages.description: Make sure to define your nodes in the pool markdown file.

pages.title: Pool should have at least one node running on ARM
pages.description: We validate this by looking at your list of nodes. We'll look for at least one node that is running on an ARM device.

pages.title: Pool is recommended to completely run on ARM
pages.description: We validate this by looking at your list of nodes. We'll look for at least one block producer and one relay that run on an ARM device.

pages.title: Ada (₳)
pages.description: The digital currency (or cryptocurrency) of the Cardano blockchain. 1 Ada = 1 million Lovelaces. Ada and Lovelace are named after the mathematician [Ada Lovelace](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ada_Lovelace).

pages.title: ACTUS
pages.description: Algorithmic Contract Types Unified Standards. A taxonomy and standard for financial contracts.

pages.title: ASIC
pages.description: An “Application Specific Integrated Circuit” is a silicon chip specifically designed to do a single task.

pages.title: Active endpoint
pages.description: An endpoint that is active on a contract application instance.

pages.title: Ada (₳)
pages.description: The digital currency (or cryptocurrency) of the Cardano blockchain. 1 Ada = 1 million Lovelace. Ada and Lovelace are named after the mathematician [Ada Lovelace](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ada_Lovelace).

pages.title: Adalite
pages.description: A simple Cardano web wallet developed by Cardano partners Vacuumlabs.

pages.title: address
pages.description: The address of an UTXO says where the output is “going”.

pages.title: Adrestia
pages.description: Adrestia is a collection of products which makes it easier to integrate with [Cardano](/en/terms/cardano).

pages.title: Airdrop
pages.description: Airdrop is a term for marketing campaign launched by many ICOs in which they distributes their specific token to the general public.

pages.title: Alice and Bob
pages.description: Cryptographic protocols are often made clearer by considering parties A and B, or Alice and Bob, performing some protocol.

pages.title: Altcoins
pages.description: Altcoin is an abbreviation of “Bitcoin alternative”.

pages.title: Asset-group
pages.description: A collection of tokens/assets that share the same minting policy.

pages.title: Atomic swap
pages.description: Atomic swap is a technology based on smart contracts that enables the exchange of different cryptocurrencies without the need for a centralized market or other intermediaries.

pages.title: Balance wallet
pages.description: A wallet that stores your initial testnet ada balance, copied from the mainnet via the balance snapshot.

pages.title: Basho
pages.description: Fourth phase of Cardano development in which performance improvements will be integrated.
aliases: what are the phases of cardano

pages.title: Byzantine Fault Tolerance (BFT)
pages.description: Byzantine fault tolerance (BFT), is a property in the system that ensures there is resistance to certain types of failures.

pages.title: Block
pages.description: A slot that contains a set of recent transactions on a blockchain network. Each block contains data required to manage the blockchain, including an encrypted version of the previous block.

pages.title: Blockchain explorer
pages.description: An online tool for exploring the blockchain of a particular cryptocurrency, where you can watch and follow live all the transactions happening on the blockchain.

pages.title: Blockchain
pages.description: A growing list of records, called blocks, that are linked using cryptography. Each block contains a cryptographic hash of the previous block, a timestamp, and transaction data. Blockchain is a fundamental system underpinning cryptocurrencies, acting as the public transaction ledger.

pages.title: Byron
pages.description: The name of the first ‘boot strap’ phase of Cardano development. The first era of the Cardano blockchain.

pages.title: Cardano-cli-js
pages.description: This is a library, which wraps the cardano-cli with JavaScript and makes it possible to interact with the cli-commands much faster and more efficient.

pages.title: Cardano-CLI
pages.description: The command line interface from which a user can interact with the Cardano node and blockchain.
aliases: submit a transaction on cardano using the cli

pages.title: Cardano Foundation
pages.description: An independent standards body based in Switzerland with core responsibilities to oversee and supervise the development of Cardano and its ecosystem.

pages.title: Cardano node
pages.description: A participant on the Cardano blockchain network, continuously making, sending, receiving, and validating blocks.

pages.title: Cardano
pages.description: Cardano is a proof-of-stake blockchain platform: the first to be founded on peer-reviewed research and developed through evidence-based methods.

pages.title: Contract for difference (CFD)
pages.description: Part of a wider group of trading products known as derivatives, they are a popular method of trading stocks, bonds, and commodities that allow you to speculate on the price.

pages.title: Chain
pages.description: A set of blocks that have been produced and are connected to one another in consecutive order.

pages.title: Cold wallet
pages.description: A cold wallet or cold storage is a type of cryptocurrency wallet aiming for maximum security.

pages.title: Consensus
pages.description: A way for a decentralized system to reach a consistent view of shared collections of data. Cardano uses the Ouroboros consensus algorithm, which is an algorithm based on proof of stake.

pages.title: Contract application
pages.description: An application written against the contract application API, which runs in the PAB.

pages.title: Contract Executable
pages.description: A compiled executable of a contract application.

pages.title: Cost per epoch
pages.description: A fixed fee, in ada, which the stake pool operator takes every epoch from the pool rewards to cover the costs of running a stake pool.
aliases: cardano stake pool operators fixed fee
cardano stake pool operators cost per epoch

pages.title: Crypto mining
pages.description: In proof-of-work blockchain's like Bitcoin mining is the process by which new crypto-currencies or digital assets are created and distributed to the blockchain's decentralized ledger.

pages.title: Cryptocurrency Wallet
pages.description: A cryptocurrency wallet or simply wallet is a software application or hardware device that is used to receive and send cryptocurrencies.

pages.title: Cryptocurrency
pages.description: The process by which new coins of creating new

pages.title: Currency
pages.description: A class of token whose forging is controlled by a particular monetary policy script.

pages.title: Daedalus
pages.description: A secure wallet for Ada that manages balances and provides the ability to send and receive payments.

pages.title: DApp
pages.description: Decentralized application.

pages.title: Datum
pages.description: The data field on script outputs in the Extended UTXO model.

pages.title: DeFi
pages.description: Decentralized finance. Refers to financial instruments and mechanisms built on the blockchain using smart contracts. Examples include swaps, bonding curves, and escrow.

pages.title: Decentralized
pages.description: Decentralization refers to the property of a system in which nodes or actors work in concert in a distributed fashion to achieve a global goal.

pages.title: Delegate
pages.description: The process by which Ada owners can participate in the network and earn rewards by delegating the stake associated with their Ada holdings to a stake pool.

pages.title: Digital Asset
pages.description: A digital item of property that holds value stored in the distributed ledger.

pages.title: Double spending problem
pages.description: When a digital currency is spent more than once. Historically this was a problem with early versions of cryptocurrencies.  Bitcoin was the first cryptocurrency to solve this problem.

pages.title: EMURGO
pages.description: EMURGO is a multinational blockchain technology company providing solutions for developers, startups, enterprises, and governments.

pages.title: Endpoint
pages.description: A potential request made by a contract application for user input. Every endpoint has a name and a type.

pages.title: Epoch
pages.description: a defined group of slots that constitute a period of time. In Cardano, one epoch is 5 days long.

pages.title: EUTXO
pages.description: Extended unspent transaction output model of Cardano.

pages.title: Fake Stake Attack
pages.description: This is the umbrella term that references the various vulnerabilities of Proof-of-Stake cryptocurrencies like Cardano.

pages.title: Faucet
pages.description: A web-based service that provides free tokens to users of a testnet.

pages.title: Fee
pages.description: Amount of ada or other cryptocurrency charged for transaction processing.

pages.title: Fifty-one percent attack
pages.description: If more than half the computer power on a network is run by a single person or a single group of people, then a 51% attack is in operation.

pages.title: Forging context
pages.description: A data structure containing a summary of the transaction being validated, and the current forging policy which is being run.

pages.title: Forging policy script
pages.description: A script which must be satisfied in order for a transaction to forge tokens of the corresponding currency.

pages.title: Forging
pages.description: A transaction which forges tokens creates new tokens, providing that the corresponding monetary policy script is satisfied.

pages.title: Fork
pages.description: A significant update to the software governing a blockchain platform, which may change rules, make existing rules invalid, or create new rules, is called a fork.

pages.title: Fungible token/asset
pages.description: an asset that is interchangeable and indistinguishable with some other asset(s). Same denomination bills and coins are fungible assets, for example, like equal quantities of ada to lovelaces.

pages.title: Genesis block
pages.description: The very first block ever created on a blockchain.
aliases: first ever block created on cardano blockchain

pages.title: Goguen
pages.description: Third phase of Cardano development in which smart contracts will be delivered.

pages.title: Hard Fork
pages.description: A radical change of the network’s protocol changing the state of operational flow from one model to a completely different one.
aliases: cardano native asset hard fork event

pages.title: Hardware wallet
pages.description: A hardware wallet is a special type of wallet that stores the user's private keys in a secure hardware device.

pages.title: HODL
pages.description: The term HODL refers to buy-and-hold strategies adopted by members of bitcoin and other cryptocurrency communities.

pages.title: Hot wallet
pages.description: A hot wallet is a cryptocurrency wallet which is or was connected to the internet. One of the advantages of hot wallets is that they can be used to make small everyday transactions.

pages.title: Hydra
pages.description: A layer 2 scalibility solution for the Cardano blockchain.

pages.title: Incentive
pages.description: A way to encourage participants of the system to engage in the network by rewarding them with a return that is proportional to their efforts.

pages.title: Interoperability
pages.description: One of the significant features within Cardano development that aims to enable interconnection between numerous blockchains and legitimate recognition of activities by central authorities. Enabled cross-chain transfers and the establishment of the internet of blockchains will grant enhanced user experience and functionality.

pages.title: IPFS
pages.description: The InterPlanetary File System (IPFS) is a hypermedia distribution protocol, addressed by content and identities.

pages.title: Key pair
pages.description: A set of two keys: public verification key and private signing key. These keys are used to process and approve transactions within the blockchain.

pages.title: Ledger wallet
pages.description: A combination of hardware and software that allows you to securely manage your crypto and guides you on your journey towards financial freedom.

pages.title: Ledger
pages.description: A distributed database that is operated in a decentralized manner by multiple nodes across numerous locations.

pages.title: Live stake
pages.description: The total amount of stake that a stake pool controls. It combines the stake that is owned by the pool operator with any stake that has been delegated to the pool by other ada holders. It can be measured as a total ada amount (e.g. 3M ada), or as a percentage of the total supply of ada within the network (e.g. 5%).

pages.title: Lovelace
pages.description: The smallest unit of Ada. 1 Lovelace = 1/1,000,000 Ada. A lovelace is to Ada what a Satoshi is to Bitcoin.

pages.title: Mainnet
pages.description: A live blockchain that has been deployed and is in operation.

pages.title: Marlowe
pages.description: The domain-specific language (DSL) for writing and executing financial contracts on blockchain.

pages.title: Metadata
pages.description: A set of additional data stating certain transaction conditions or owner details.

pages.title: Minting transaction
pages.description: Transactions with a field specifying token minting details.

pages.title: Minting
pages.description: Also referred to as “Token minting”. The process by which new blocks are created.

pages.title: Multi-asset
pages.description: A generic term for a ledger which supports multiple different asset types natively.

pages.title: Multisig
pages.description: Simple multiple signature scripting language supported by Cardano Shelly.

pages.title: Native token
pages.description: A token type accounting and tracking of which is natively supported by its underlying platform without a need for additional software.

pages.title: Network
pages.description: The technical infrastructure combining Cardano nodes and their relative interactions in one unified system.

pages.title: Non-fungible token/asset (NFT)
pages.description: Non-fungible tokens (NFTs) are digital assets that are provably unique, creating digital scarcity. They can't be duplicated or divided.

pages.title: Ouroboros Byzantine Fault Tolerance
pages.description: The Cardano network makes use of its Ouroboros Byzantine fault tolerant protocol to ensure security and stability of the entire system.
aliases: cardano network ouroboros byzantine fault tolerant protocol
cardano proof of stake byzantine fault tolerant

pages.title: Off-chain-code
pages.description: The part of a smart contract application’s code which runs off the chain, usually as a contract application.

pages.title: On-chain-code
pages.description: The part of a contract application’s code which runs on the chain (i.e. as scripts).

pages.title: Oracle Pool
pages.description: A method by which Oracles are decentralized, such that the external data they provide can be done so with greater assurance and trust. [More information](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QcNZYhAa2xU).

pages.title: Oracle
pages.description: A mechanism by which critical external information that isn’t known or available to a blockchain network is transferred to the network. This can be any kind of information (currency or commodity exchange rates, events happening in the real world, etc.).

pages.title: Ouroboros
pages.description: Cardano’s proof of stake algorithm.

pages.title: PAB client API
pages.description: A program which interacts with a contract application instance via the PAB’s client API.

pages.title: Passive node
pages.description: A Cardano node (relay) that has no incoming connections.

pages.title: Peer discovery
pages.description: The process by which nodes find each other on the network and initiate contact

pages.title: Peer-to-peer (P2P)
pages.description: Peer-to-peer. Sending transactions or sharing files directly between nodes in a decentralized system without depending on a centralized authority.
aliases: decentralized peer to peer file sharing

pages.title: Pledge
pages.description: Pledging is an important mechanism that encourages the growth of a healthy ecosystem within the Cardano blockchain.

pages.title: Plutus Application Backend (PAB)
pages.description: The component which manages Plutus Applications that run on users' machines.

pages.title: Plutus application
pages.description: An application written using the Plutus Application Framework.

pages.title: Plutus core
pages.description: The programming language in which scripts on the Cardano blockchain are written.

pages.title: Plutus IR
pages.description: An intermediate language that compiles to Plutus Core.

pages.title: Plutus platform
pages.description: The combined software support for writing contract applications

pages.title: Plutus SDK
pages.description: The libraries and development tooling for writing contract applications in Haskell.

pages.title: Plutus Tx
pages.description: The libraries and compiler for compiling Haskell into Plutus Core to form the on-chain part of a contract application.

pages.title: Plutus
pages.description: A Turing-complete programming platform for writing functional smart contracts on the Cardano blockchain.

pages.title: Private key
pages.description: A private key is a randomly generated secret number that should only be known to the owner of the associated address.

pages.title: Produced blocks
pages.description: The number of blocks that have been produced by a stake pool in the current epoch. Stake pools are rewarded in ada for each block that they produce.

pages.title: Proof of stake (PoS)
pages.description: A type of consensus mechanism used to reach agreement on records in the blockchain. It ensures distributed consensus based on the stake, or wealth, that is held by participants in the system. This stake is used as the main resource to determine the participant’s power in the system for maintaining the ledger.

pages.title: Proof of work (PoW)
pages.description: The original consensus algorithm in early blockchain networks, such as Bitcoin. This algorithm is used to confirm transactions and produce new blocks to the chain. With PoW, “miners” (those performing the computational work) compete against each other to complete transactions on the network and get rewarded.

pages.title: Protocol
pages.description: A term used for consensus reaching methods. For instance, Ouroboros protocol, OBFT protocol.

pages.title: Public key
pages.description: A definition of a term

pages.title: Redeemer
pages.description: The argument to the validator script which is provided by the transaction which spends a script output.

pages.title: Reward
pages.description: An amount contained in each new block that is paid out to the stakeholder by the network.

pages.title: Rewards wallet
pages.description: A wallet that stores ada which can be used in stake delegation. The stake from a single Rewards wallet can only be delegated to a single stake pool.
aliases: cardano stake pool operator rewards wallet
cardano stake pool owner rewards wallets

pages.title: SatoshiLabs
pages.description: Established in late 2013, SatoshiLabs is a company full of experienced specialists founded by two of the leading personalities in the crypto community.

pages.title: Satoshi
pages.description: The smallest unit of Bitcoin, equal to 0.00000001 BTC.

pages.title: Saturation
pages.description: A term used to indicate that a particular stake pool has more stake delegated to it than is ideal for the network.
aliases: cardano stake pool over saturated pools

pages.title: Schema
pages.description: The set of all endpoints of a contract application.

pages.title: Script output
pages.description: A UTXO locked by a script.

pages.title: Script
pages.description: A generic term for an executable program in the ledger. In the Cardano blockchain, these are written in Plutus Core.

pages.title: Securitization
pages.description: The process of creating liquid, asset-backed securities from pools of illiquid assets.

pages.title: Security token
pages.description: A digital asset that derives its value from an external asset that can be traded.

pages.title: Shelly
pages.description: Second phase of Cardano development in which network decentralization will be delivered.

pages.title: Slot leader
pages.description: Elected node that has been selected to create a block within the current slot. A random election process occurs based on the proportional stake.

pages.title: Slot
pages.description: A fixed period of time within an epoch.

pages.title: Smart contract
pages.description: An automated agreement, written in code, that tracks, verifies, and executes the binding transactions of a contract between various parties.
aliases: cardano alonzo hard fork smart contracts
when will cardano get smart contracts​
when are smart contracts coming to cardano​

pages.title: Stablecoin
pages.description: A cryptocurrency that attempts to offer stability and generally (preferably) backed by a reserve asset. USD Tether and USD Coin are examples of stablecoins backed by US dollars.

pages.title: Stake Pool Alliance
pages.description: An alliance of stake pool operators on the Cardano blockchain.

pages.title: Stake pool operator (SPO)
pages.description: The person(s) or organization(s) operating a stake pool.

pages.title: Stake pool performance
pages.description: A measure of the efficiency of a stake pool, given as a percentage, is measured by how many blocks the stake pool has produced (and that are recorded on the main chain) compared to how many it was nominated to produce.

pages.title: Stake pool profit margin
pages.description: The percentage of total ada rewards that the stake pool operator takes before sharing the rest of the rewards between all the delegators to the pool.

pages.title: Stake pool
pages.description: A reliable block-producing server node that holds the combined stake of various stakeholders in a single entity, or pool, on the Cardano network.

pages.title: Staking
pages.description: The process by which Ada owners can participate in the network and earn rewards by delegating the stake associated with their Ada holdings to a stake pool.

pages.title: Sybil Attack
pages.description: Sybil Attack is a type of attack seen in peer-to-peer networks in which a node in the network operates multiple identities actively at the same time and undermines the authority/power in reputation systems.

pages.title: Testnet
pages.description: A test network where users can experiment with new features and code and provide their feedback before a live mainnet launch.

pages.title: Token minting
pages.description: The process of creating new tokens.

pages.title: Token
pages.description: A cryptographic token that represents a footprint of value defined by the community, market state, or self-governed entity. A token can be fungible or non-fungible, and act as a payment unit, reward, trading asset, or information holder.

pages.title: Tokenization
pages.description: The process of representing real-world assets with digital tokens.

pages.title: TPS
pages.description: Transaction per second

pages.title: Trezor wallet
pages.description: Trezor Wallet is an easy-to-use browser interface for the Trezor device powered by SatoshiLabs.

pages.title: Trezor
pages.description: Trezor (or Trezor device) is the original and most trusted cryptocurrency hardware wallet designed and marketed by [SatoshiLabs](/en/terms/satoshi-labs.md).

pages.title: Trusted peer
pages.description: Other trusted nodes in the network.

pages.title: Utility token
pages.description: A digital token that holds certain functionality in regards to a concrete project or environment. These tokens can be used as payment units, rewards, or grant access to a specific network.

pages.title: UTXO
pages.description: UTXO stands for “Unspent Transaction Output”. In cryptocurrencies, a UTXO is an abstraction of electronic money. Each UTXO is analogous to a coin, and holds a certain amount of value in its respective currency.

pages.title: Validator context
pages.description: A data structure containing a summary of the transaction being validated, and the current input whose validator is being run.

pages.title: Validator script
pages.description: The script attached to a script output in the Extended UTXO model.

pages.title: Voltaire
pages.description: The fifth phase of Cardano development in which treasury and governance capabilities will be delivered.

pages.title: Whale 🐋
pages.description: A whale is defined as a person or organization that owns a large amount of a particular cryptocurrency.

pages.title: Yoroi
pages.description: A light wallet for Cardano that is used to manage Ada balances and conduct transactions. A simple, fast, and secure wallet for daily use purposes that is developed by Emurgo. [More information](https://yoroi-wallet.com/#/).

pages.title: Zero knowledge proof
pages.description: In cryptography, a zero-knowledge proof enables one party to provide evidence that a transaction or event happened without revealing private details of that transaction or event.

pages.title: ACTUS
pages.description: Algorithmic Contract Types Unified Standards (Estandar Unificado de Tipos de Contratos Algorítmicos). Una clasificación y un estándar para contratos financieros.

pages.title: ADA (₳)
pages.description: Moneda digital (o criptomoneda) de la cadena de bloques de Cardano. 1 ADA = 1 millón de Lovelaces. Ada y Lovelace deben su nombre a la matemática [Ada Lovelace](https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ada_Lovelace).

pages.title: address
pages.description: La dirección de un UTXO dice hacia dónde “va” la salida.

pages.title: Airdrop
pages.description: Airdrop es un término para un tipo de campañas de publicidad utilizadas por muchas ICO en las que distribuyen su token al público general.

pages.title: Altcoins
pages.description: Altcoin es una abreviatura de "Bitcoin Alternativa".

pages.title: Basho
pages.description: Cuarta fase de desarrollo de Cardano en la que se integrarán mejoras de rendimiento.
aliases: what are the phases of cardano

pages.title: Blockchain
pages.description: es una cadena de bloques que contiene información. Estos bloques son una lista creciente de registros que están vinculados mediante criptografía. Cada bloque contiene un hash criptográfico del bloque anterior, una marca de tiempo y datos de la transacción. Blockchain es un sistema fundamental que sustenta las criptomonedas, que actúa como el libro mayor de transacciones públicas.

pages.title: Cardano-CLI
pages.description: Es la interfaz de línea de comandos (CLI, Command Line Interface) desde la cual un usuario puede interactuar con el nodo de Cardano y la blockchain.
aliases: submit a transaction on cardano using the cli

pages.title: Daedalus
pages.description: Es una billetera segura para guarda ADA desde la que se administran los saldos y además, brinda la capacidad de enviar y recibir pagos.

pages.title: Descentralizado
pages.description: La descentralización se refiere a la propiedad de un sistema en el que los nodos o actores trabajan en concierto de manera distribuida para lograr un objetivo global.

pages.title: Delegar
pages.description: El proceso mediante el cual los propietarios de ADA pueden participar en la red y ganar recompensas al delegar sus ADA directamente desde su billetera a un Stake Pool de Cardano.

pages.title: Ouroboros
pages.description: Algoritmo de Prueba de Participación (PoS) de Cardano.

pages.title: Prueba de Trabajo (PoW)
pages.description: Es el algoritmo de consenso original de las primeras redes blockchain, como Bitcoin. Este algoritmo se utiliza para confirmar transacciones y producir nuevos bloques en la cadena. Con PoW (Proof of Work), los "mineros" (aquellos que realizan el trabajo computacional) compiten entre sí para completar transacciones en la red y obtener recompensas.

pages.title: Utility token
pages.description: Un token digital que tiene cierta funcionalidad con respecto a un proyecto o entorno concreto. Estos tokens se pueden usar como unidades de pago, recompensas o otorgar acceso a una red específica.

pages.title: UTXO
pages.description: UTXO (Unspent Transaction Output) significa "Salida de transacción no gastada". En las criptomonedas, un UTXO es una abstracción de dinero electrónico. Cada UTXO es análogo a una moneda y tiene una cierta cantidad de valor en su respectiva moneda.

pages.title: Voltaire
pages.description: La quinta y última fase o Era del desarrollo de Cardano, en la cual el Tesoro y la Gobernanza serán entregadas totalmente a la Comunidad para su gestión y toma de decisiones.

pages.title: Whale 🐋
pages.description: Una ballena (whale) se define como una persona u organización que es propietaria de una cantidad muy grande de una criptomoneda determinada.

pages.title: Yoroi
pages.description: es una billetera ligera para Cardano que se instala como extensión del navegador y se usa para administrar los saldos de ADA y realizar transacciones. Es una billetera simple, rápida y segura para uso diario desarrollada por Emurgo. [Más información](https://yoroi-wallet.com/#/).

pages.title: Ada (₳)
pages.description: De digitale valuta (of cryptocurrency) van de Cardano-blockchain. 1 Ada = 1 miljoen Lovelaces. Ada en Lovelace zijn vernoemd naar de wiskundige [Ada Lovelace](https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ada_Lovelace).

pages.title: Ada (₳)
pages.description: De digitale valuta (of cryptocurrency) van de Cardano-blockchain. 1 Ada = 1 miljoen Lovelaces. Ada en Lovelace zijn vernoemd naar de wiskundige [Ada Lovelace](https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ada_Lovelace).

pages.title: Cardano
pages.description: Cardano is een proof-of-stake blockchain: het eerste dat is gebaseerd op peer-reviewed onderzoek en is ontwikkeld met behulp van wetenschappelijke methodes.

pages.title: Utility token
pages.description: Een digitaal token dat bepaalde functionaliteit bevat met betrekking tot een concreet project of een concrete omgeving. Deze tokens kunnen worden gebruikt als betalingseenheden, beloningen of toegang verlenen tot een specifiek netwerk.

pages.title: UTXO
pages.description: UTXO staat voor "Unspent Transaction Output". In cryptocurrencies is een UTXO een abstractie van elektronisch geld. Elke UTXO is analoog aan een munt en heeft een bepaalde waarde in zijn respectieve valuta.

props.excerpt: Byzantine fault tolerance (BFT), is a property in the system that ensures there is resistance to certain types of failures.
